com.twiddles.ganesha.functionality
Interface RDFFile

All Known Implementing Classes:
JenaFile
public interface RDFFile

Interface for accessing, modifying and creating data in an RDF/XML file. Anything that can be uniquely identified by a URI is considered a resource. An RDF file may contain any number of resources, each with one or more properties describing them. When the value of a resource property itself has properties but no URI to identify it it is known as an anonymous resource.

This interface provides methods for accessing and adding resources in an RDF/XML file, creating predicates and objects to form properties about a resource and dealing with the actual file input/output.

See Also:
RDFResource, RDFProperty, RDFPredicate, RDFObject

Method Detail

newFile

void newFile()
Creates blank RDF data in memory. If previous RDF data is present it is cleared.

loadFile

void loadFile(java.io.File file)
              throws RdfIOException
Reads in RDF data from a given RDF/XML file.

Parameters:
file - the file to load
Throws:
RdfIOException - if the file cannot be loaded or contains invalid RDF/XML

saveFile

void saveFile()
              throws RdfIOException
Saves the current RDF data to the current file.

Throws:
RdfIOException - if there is a write error

saveFile

void saveFile(java.io.File file)
              throws RdfIOException
Saves the loaded RDF data to a file different from the current one.

Parameters:
file - the file to write to
Throws:
RdfIOException - if there is a write error

getFileName

java.lang.String getFileName()
Returns the name of the file from which the currently loaded RDF data originates. This is usually the name of the file which was loaded unless a new file has been created since then or the data was written to a different file.

Returns:
the current file name (null if there is no filename).
See Also:
newFile(), loadFile(File), saveFile(File)

getResources

RDFResource[] getResources()
Retrieves all resources from the currently loaded data that have properties describing them. This includes anonymous resources.

Returns:
array of all the resources that are currently loaded

getResTypes

java.lang.String[][] getResTypes()
Returns a list of known resource types. The list is an array of 2 element arrays. Each sub-array has a discriptive name as its first element and the full URI of the tpye as its second element.

Returns:
list of known resource type names and URIs

getPropTypes

RDFPredicate[] getPropTypes()
Returns a list of known property types.

Returns:
list of known predicates
